name: Ninite
headline: Simple third-party app patching and deployment for Windows.
description:
The BaseShield App Store is a distribution platform for Windows software. Users can download and install applications with one click, and each application runs in its own secure virtual space.

It is an open platform where third party developers can publish their applications. Developers who deploy their apps this way can rely on the built-in installer, update function, security and eventually payment processing.

# We also have a page for screenreader-friendly accessible apps at [ninite.com/accessible](http://ninite.com/</accessible>).
#### Install and Update All Your Programs at Once
No toolbars. No clicking next. Just pick your apps and go. 
![A Ninite Installer](https://ninite.com/static/img/screenshot-d19f898aea36be8dcd93c3af7de4abb0.png)
#### Always Up-to-date
You don't have to watch for updates. Our bots do that. Here's what's new:
Opera Chromium updated to 117.0.5408.35. 3 hours ago
qBittorrent updated to 5.0.4. 12 hours ago
Chrome updated to 133.0.6943.127. 12 hours ago
Dropbox updated to 218.4.4348. 21 hours ago
Thunderbird ESR 128 updated to 128.7.1. 21 hours ago
[more news](http://ninite.com/</news>)
#### Trusted by Millions
We install and update about a million apps each day for our home users and [Ninite Pro](http://ninite.com/</pro>) subscribers. 
The [press](http://ninite.com/</press>) likes us too: 
“I'll bet the service saved me a couple hours” **PCWorld**
“Ninite.com frees up your day” **The Christian Science Monitor**
“This post can be fairly short because Ninite works exactly as advertised.” **Lifehacker**
As of February 14th, 2019 Ninite has ended support for Windows XP and Windows Vista as well as the related server platforms Server 2003 and Server 2008.
You'll need to upgrade your Windows version to continue using Ninite.

generated_description:
Ninite is a startup founded as part of Y Combinator's Winter 2008 batch, located in San Francisco. At its core, Ninite simplifies the tedious process of patching and deploying third-party applications on Windows systems. With a small team of just two, it has built a reputation as a trusted solution for users looking to install and update applications seamlessly.

Initially launched as The BaseShield App Store, Ninite's platform allows users to download and install multiple software applications with a single click. The applications operate in a secure, virtualized environment, and the web interface is clean—no toolbars or extra clicks required. Users simply select the apps they want from a curated list, and Ninite handles the rest.

This efficiency has its roots in automation; Ninite's bots continually check for updates, ensuring that users' software remains up-to-date without the hassle of manual oversight. Each day, the service powers the installation and updates of about a million apps for both home users and Ninite Pro subscribers, underscoring its widespread adoption.

On the developer side, Ninite serves as an open platform allowing third-party developers to publish their applications. This includes leveraging Ninite's built-in installation procedures, update functions, and security measures, making it an attractive option for those looking to reach a wider audience without grappling with the complexities of software distribution.

For organizations with multiple machines to manage, Ninite Pro offers additional features for managing software deployment from a centralized web interface. Thousands of organizations use Ninite Pro to maintain and secure their software efficiently, reinforcing its value as more than just a utility for individual users.

In sum, Ninite captures a simple yet powerful idea: a streamlined experience for software installation and maintenance that saves users time and effort. If you're running Windows and frequently find yourself installing software, Ninite is a tool worth checking out. Their website is [ninite.com](http://ninite.com), where everything operates ad-free and with minimal fuss.
